comments:
When I used the Eclipse2.1.2 to run the Explore Example in the IBM article --
Using the Eclipse GUI outside the Eclipse Workbench, Part 1: Using JFace and 
SWT in standalone mode, it did not work, and report such exceptions:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
org/eclipse/core/internal/boot/DelegatingURLClassLoader
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:413)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.updateItem
(StructuredViewer.java:1271)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.createTreeItem
(AbstractTreeViewer.java:320)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer$1.run
(AbstractTreeViewer.java:303)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.createChildren
(AbstractTreeViewer.java:289)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer$5.run
(AbstractTreeViewer.java:729)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection
(StructuredViewer.java:801)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.inputChanged
(AbstractTreeViewer.java:721)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ContentViewer.setInput
(ContentViewer.java:238)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.setInput
(StructuredViewer.java:991)
	at cn.edu.buaa.sei.explore.Explorer.createContents(Explorer.java:27)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:302)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:552)
	at cn.edu.buaa.sei.explore.Explorer.main(Explorer.java:33)

And the Java VM halted illegally.
But it worked correctly in Eclipse2.1.0.
I used the first Explore example, which contains two files: Explore.java and 
FileTreeContentProvider.java.
Ines please see if this is a problem in 3.0

I am not sure which Explorer example you are referring to. I ran the Explorer 
4 source code from http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/os-ecgui1/.
It takes a little bit more configuration to get it running under M8. Make sure 
you have your build paths set up correctly. But I have successfully run it on 
Eclipse 2.1.0 and M8 (N20040412).

I just ran it correctly on Eclipse 2.1.2 as well.

Steps:
- Create a Java project.
- Copy the Explorer 4 files (5 files) to the package.
- Import the following plug-ins:
*org.apache.xerces
*org.eclispe.core.boot
*org.eclipse.core.resources
*org.eclipse.core.resources.win32
*org.eclispe.core.runtime
*org.eclispe.jface
*org.eclipse.swt
*org.eclipse.swt.win32
- Right click on your project, and select Properties.
- Select Java Build Path on the left tree.
- Check org.eclispe.jface under the Projects tab
- Add swt.jar (under org.eclispe.swt.win32 in your plug-ins directory) to the 
libraries path under the Libraries tab.
- Open the Explorer.java file in your project (should contain the main method).
- Run as Java Application
